results.title: No fixed address
results.brief_description: Follows a television reporter who becomes for a day and a night one of Melbourne’s homeless men. Shows the queue for lodging and food at the Gill Memorial Home, the City Mission, and other hostels and refuges. The reporter talks to some of these men, most of whom are unemployed - many unemployable in their present state. They tell of their daytime wandering of the streets, their difficulty in finding employment and the escape for some that alcohol brings. The problem of rehabilitation is discussed.

results.title: No fences, no boundaries: Walter Burley Griffin
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Australia Council and Tristram Miall
results.brief_description: Looks at the architect, Walter Burley Griffin’s work in Australia, with particular emphasis on his plans for the building of Canberra, Australia’s capital city. Cast: Caroline Tessandier as Marion Griffin.

results.title: No fences for Baronne: Baronne Champs libres
results.creator_credit: Jacscam Enterprises and Claude R Camredon
results.brief_description: This film describes the contrast of freedom and work for the horses in the beautiful and wild region of the Swiss Jura. It also presents exciting, unique events and popular races.

results.title: No fear, no die = Sen fout la mort [NTSC] (D)
results.creator_credit: Cinea, Pyramid Films, Les Films de Mindif, Camera One, NEF Filmproduktion, La Sept, Francis Boespflug, Philippe Carcassonne and Claire Denis
results.brief_description: This unsettling and at times disturbing film deals with the unpalatable and violent practice of illegal cockfighting in France. But director Claire Denis (Chocolat, Good work, Nenette and Boni) looks further into the motives and reasons behind those who indulge in this rather nasty past-time and in doing so has produced a film with soul and depth, exploring the complexities of human nature. The story revolves around the two main characters of Dah (Isaach de Bankole), an African immigrant and Jocelyn (Alex Descas), a West Indian, who team up in a partnership to train and supply fighting cocks for the rather unsavoury bar-owner Pierre Ardennes (Jean-Claude Brialy) whose soul aim is to make big money through holding cockfights in the basement of his saloon. Add to this fray, Toni (Solveig Dommartin), Ardennes’ mistress who becomes involved with Dah, Jocelyn’s obsession with the cocks, and money - everyone wanting more of it - and things begin to escalate. Harsh, bleak and realistic portrayal by an exceptional cast, with excellent directing by Denis, and confronting and extraordinary visuals by cinematographer Pascal Marti. NB: WARNING - Includes several graphic scenes of cockfighting and handling. In French with English subtitles.
results.title_for_label: No fear, no die = Sen fout la mort [NTSC] (D)

results.title: No easy answers
results.creator_credit: B F A and Michael Creedman
results.brief_description: Science is now offering society powerful tools for controlling threats to human life, health and security; but at the same time, scientists are aware that the solutions of the past were often the cause of serious new problems. This film explores the opportunities and dangers of the new scientific frontiers and examines human and environmental repercussions of current attempts to control weather.

results.title: No easy answer
results.creator_credit: Anti-Defamation League, Vassar College, Dept. of Child study and L. Joseph Stone
results.brief_description: Deals with the problem of prejudice against Jewish children. When a six-year-old Jewish girl indicates that she was involved in an antisemitic incident, her parents and their friends discuss the problem. They recall their own childhood experiences of such situations. Different approaches on the problem of protecting children from attacks are suggested. The film promotes discussion of situations involving prejudice.

results.title: No chalk talk (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Ron May
results.brief_description: Discusses new concept of science education where science is taught through participation rather than diagrammatically. Interview with Australian Science Education Project’s instigator Mr B. Howard. Teachers discuss use of core material, electives, and their changing roles.

results.title: No bugles, no drums
results.creator_credit: Seven Emus Productions, Australian Film Commission, Debra Beattie-Burnett and John Burnett
results.brief_description: The untold story of Aboriginal involvement in World War II. This program promises to be a striking reminder of the contribution made by the Aboriginal people during Australia’s darkest hours.

results.title: No big money
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Taylor and Doug White
results.brief_description: The Hudon family left the city to become modern pioneers on their ranch in the Cariboo country of British Columbia The winters are harsh, the work load is heavy, money is scarce, but they live on their own land. The film presents an unvarnished look at the problems and joys they experience as a family.
